result.markdown:
---
title: "Stats in R"
author: "Brady Johnston"
editor: visual
callout-icon: false
---


::: callout-note
## Learning Objectives

-   Learn some stats!
:::

-   Numerical summaries of variables (incl. assigning/changing factor levels, setting thresholds, missing data, identifying outliers)

-   Assumptions for specific tests (incl. normality)

-   Tests: chi-squared, t-test, one-way ANOVA, two-way ANOVA, correlations/regressions, and corresponding non-parametric tests

-   Effect size/Power\


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.2 ──
✔ ggplot2 3.3.6     ✔ purrr   0.3.4
✔ tibble  3.1.8     ✔ dplyr   1.0.9
✔ tidyr   1.2.0     ✔ stringr 1.4.1
✔ readr   2.1.2     ✔ forcats 0.5.1
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# chi-squared
# t-test
t.test(rnorm(100), mu = 0) |> summary()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
            Length Class  Mode     
statistic   1      -none- numeric  
parameter   1      -none- numeric  
p.value     1      -none- numeric  
conf.int    2      -none- numeric  
estimate    1      -none- numeric  
null.value  1      -none- numeric  
stderr      1      -none- numeric  
alternative 1      -none- character
method      1      -none- character
data.name   1      -none- character
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
t.test(rnorm(100), mu = 10) |> summary()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
            Length Class  Mode     
statistic   1      -none- numeric  
parameter   1      -none- numeric  
p.value     1      -none- numeric  
conf.int    2      -none- numeric  
estimate    1      -none- numeric  
null.value  1      -none- numeric  
stderr      1      -none- numeric  
alternative 1      -none- character
method      1      -none- character
data.name   1      -none- character
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# one-way ANOVA
# two-way ANOVA
aov(iris$Petal.Width ~ iris$Species, )
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Call:
   aov(formula = iris$Petal.Width ~ iris$Species)

Terms:
                iris$Species Residuals
Sum of Squares      80.41333   6.15660
Deg. of Freedom            2       147

Residual standard error: 0.20465
Estimated effects may be unbalanced
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
aov(Petal.Width ~ Species, data = iris)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
Call:
   aov(formula = Petal.Width ~ Species, data = iris)

Terms:
                 Species Residuals
Sum of Squares  80.41333   6.15660
Deg. of Freedom        2       147

Residual standard error: 0.20465
Estimated effects may be unbalanced
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
iris.aov <- aov(iris$Petal.Width ~ iris$Species)
# Summarise the ANOVA results
summary(iris.aov)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
              Df Sum Sq Mean Sq F value Pr(>F)    
iris$Species   2  80.41   40.21     960 <2e-16 ***
Residuals    147   6.16    0.04                   
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# correlations/regressions
cor.test(cars$speed, cars$dist)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

	Pearson's product-moment correlation

data:  cars$speed and cars$dist
t = 9.464, df = 48, p-value = 1.49e-12
alternative hypothesis: true correlation is not equal to 0
95 percent confidence interval:
 0.6816422 0.8862036
sample estimates:
      cor 
0.8068949 
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
lm(speed ~ dist, data = cars) |> 
  summary()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```

Call:
lm(formula = speed ~ dist, data = cars)

Residuals:
    Min      1Q  Median      3Q     Max 
-7.5293 -2.1550  0.3615  2.4377  6.4179 

Coefficients:
            Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|)    
(Intercept)  8.28391    0.87438   9.474 1.44e-12 ***
dist         0.16557    0.01749   9.464 1.49e-12 ***
---
Signif. codes:  0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1

Residual standard error: 3.156 on 48 degrees of freedom
Multiple R-squared:  0.6511,	Adjusted R-squared:  0.6438 
F-statistic: 89.57 on 1 and 48 DF,  p-value: 1.49e-12
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
# corresponding non-parametric tests
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
df <- palmerpenguins::penguins
# library(tidyverse)
df |> 
  drop_na(bill_length_mm) |> 
  group_by(species) |> 
  nest() |> 
  mutate(
    test = map(data, ~t.test(.x$bill_length_mm, .x$bill_depth_mm)), 
    values = map(test, broom::tidy)
  ) |> 
  unnest(values)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
# A tibble: 3 × 13
# Groups:   species [3]
  species   data     test    estimate estima…¹ estim…² stati…³   p.value param…⁴
  <fct>     <list>   <list>     <dbl>    <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>     <dbl>   <dbl>
1 Adelie    <tibble> <htest>     20.4     38.8    18.3    85.8 1.87e-165   210. 
2 Gentoo    <tibble> <htest>     32.5     47.5    15.0   112.  1.48e-143   146. 
3 Chinstrap <tibble> <htest>     30.4     48.8    18.4    71.1 1.18e- 75    82.3
# … with 4 more variables: conf.low <dbl>, conf.high <dbl>, method <chr>,
#   alternative <chr>, and abbreviated variable names ¹​estimate1, ²​estimate2,
#   ³​statistic, ⁴​parameter
```
